isis.stitle: TSI 95-13-04 - Spicer and Navistar 9 and 10 Speed Transmission Overdrive Shift Fork Bracket Pin Manufacturing Change

subjectgroup.subject: Spicer and Navistar 9 and 10 Speed Transmission Overdrive Shift Fork Bracket Pin Manufacturing Change

note.para: The information supplied herein has been furnished by the manufacturer and/or the supplier for use with its product. Navistar International Corp. reprints this information based on representations made to the Company by the manufacturer and/or supplier and is not responsible for any errors or untoward consequences resulting from such errors or from any misuse of the product. Every user is urged to carefully follow the instructions which accompany the product.

lev1.para: This TSI applies to all models with Spicer and Navistar 9 and 10 speed transmissions.

lev1.title: Wear Out Symptoms
lev1.para: Transmission locked in one or two gears.
Transmission Overdrive Shift Fork Bracket Pin broken into two pieces.
Transmission Overdrive Shift Bracket bolts loose.

lev1.title: Possible Causes
lev1.para: Overdrive Shift Fork Pin material, hardness, and case depth.
Overdrive Shift Fork Pin ground diameter surface defect.

lev1.title: What to Do
lev1.para: If the transmission Overdrive Shift Fork Pin is found to be broken or the Overdrive Shift Bracket Bolts are loose, replace pin with new 201-438-7 Pin and bolts with new 545002 bolts.
If necessary, replace all other damaged parts, gears, clutch collars, etc.

partsinfo.para: After 8-25-95, Overdrive Shift Fork Pin 201-438-7 will be manufactured from SAE 1018-1020 steel and the pin outside diameter will not be ground. These manufacturing changes will significantly increase the fatigue life of the pin. The new improved pin can be distinguished from the old pin by the appearance of pin surface finish. The old pin has a shiny surface finish and the new improved pin will have a dark, dull surface finish.
